dt: {bc}to arrange (troops, equipment, etc.) in a straight line and at proper intervals
{bc}to prepare for cooking or for the table
{bc}to add decorative details or accessories to {bc}{sx|embellish||}
{bc}to arrange (the hair) by combing, brushing, or curling
{bc}to kill and prepare for market or for consumption
{bc}to trim and smooth the surface of (a material, such as lumber or stone)
{bc}to put on or wear formal, elaborate, or fancy clothes
{bc}to align oneself with the next soldier in a line to make the line straight
{bc}to ornament a ship for a celebration by hoisting national ensigns at the mastheads and running a line of signal flags and pennants from bow to stern

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}drescer, dresser{/it} to direct, put right, from Vulgar Latin {it}*directiare{/it}, from Latin {it}directus{/it} direct, past participle of {it}dirigere{/it} to direct, from {it}dis-{/it} + {it}regere{/it} to lead straight {ma}{mat|right|}{/ma}
shortdef: to arrange (troops, equipment, etc.) in a straight line and at proper intervals
to prepare for use or service; specifically : to prepare for cooking or for the table

dt: {bc}an outer garment (as for a woman or girl) usually consisting of a one-piece bodice and skirt
{bc}covering, adornment, or appearance appropriate or peculiar to a particular time

shortdef: an outer garment (as for a woman or girl) usually consisting of a one-piece bodice and skirt
covering, adornment, or appearance appropriate or peculiar to a particular time

dt: {bc}the wearing of clothes designed for the opposite sex

shortdef: the wearing of clothes designed for the opposite sex

dt: {bc}to dress casually especially for reasons of fashion

shortdef: to dress casually especially for reasons of fashion

dt: {bc}to make more attractive, glamorous, or fancy

dt.t: {it}dress up{/it} a plain dessert with a rich chocolate sauce

dt: {bc}to attire in best or formal clothes
{bc}to attire in clothes suited to a particular role
{bc}to present in the most attractive or impressive light

dt.t: a fiasco {it}dressed up{/it} as a triumph

shortdef: to make more attractive, glamorous, or fancy
to attire in best or formal clothes
to attire in clothes suited to a particular role

dt: {bc}a costume (as for a masquerade) chosen to suit the wearer's fancy

shortdef: a costume (as for a masquerade) chosen to suit the wearer's fancy

dt: {bc}the style of dress prescribed for ceremonial or formal social occasions

shortdef: the style of dress prescribed for ceremonial or formal social occasions

dt: {bc}a long loose-fitting dress usually with high neck and long sleeves

shortdef: a long loose-fitting dress usually with high neck and long sleeves

dt: {bc}to place or apply plant nutrients on or in the soil near the roots of (a growing crop)

dt.t: These plants are heavy feeders, and will also need to be {wi}side-dressed{/wi} with applications of fertilizer after four weeks of growth.

shortdef: to place or apply plant nutrients on or in the soil near the roots of (a growing crop)

dt: {bc}to apply material to (something, such as a road) without working it in

dt.t: The unit can also be used to spread crushed rock in layers up to 12 cm thick for {wi}top-dressing{/wi} roads.

dt: {bc}to scatter or apply amendments (such as compost) over (soil or land)

dt.t: If you are a religious composter, you can just {wi}top-dress{/wi} your beds and borders with the contents of your bin.
{wi}Topdressing{/wi} the acidic soils with the organic matter raises the pH and allows for vegetation to return.

shortdef: to apply material to (something, such as a road) without working it in; especially : to scatter or apply amendments (such as compost) over (soil or land)
